sentence.text: Current status and prospects of HIV treatment.
Current antiviral treatments can reduce HIV-associated morbidity, prolong survival, and prevent HIV transmission
Combination antiretroviral therapy (cART) containing preferably three active drugs from two or more classes is required for durable virologic suppression

Regimen selection is based on virologic efficacy, potential for adverse effects, pill burden and dosing frequency, drug-drug interaction potential, resistance test results, comorbid conditions, social status, and cost
With prolonged virologic suppression, improved clinical outcomes, and longer survival, patients will be exposed to antiretroviral agents for decades
Therefore, maximizing the safety and tolerability of cART is a high priority
Emergence of resistance and/or lack of tolerability in individual patients require availability of a range of treatment options
Development of new drugs is focused on improving safety (e
